intro: Streblosa multiglandulosa, commonly known as the many-glandular streblosa, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves with numerous small glands. Its flowers are typically yellow or greenish-yellow, with five petals and numerous stamens. It is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and stream banks.
